Probably not, who knows. I really hate football and the commercials have really fallen off over the past couple of years. Though Prince's halftime show was amazing.
Alright, gimme a sec... these are the best photos of me ever taken...
perhaps there should be a sidebar widget showing most starred replies ever?
(also some really good ones of Holscher)
yeah, if there was a best of convore i'd nominate it

So, I know that I'm obviously astoundingly drunk in these photos, and every time I look at them I hear that TSA agent from 30 Rock going, "Crazy eyes, one way ticket to Montreal.. I should detain you." BUT, all that being said, these are still some REALLY good photos of me.

I honestly thought the Steelers were going to win - they just looked like the better team on the field. The Packers (which I prefer, I guess) really held it together and were just constantly performing above and beyond. And, they survived injury after injury. Good game. I think. I don't really know much about football. HOWEVER - I do know how to throw a party. Last night's UA party was... beyond epic. To the point where I didn't think I would survive this morning. The hangover was just absurd, just completely absurd. So, I wake up, still mostly drunk, and remember that the night before my friends convinced me to throw a superbowl party. There are assholes. I've never even watched the superbowl, much less thrown a party. So, I read up on how TV works (apparently it's like magnets, via magic) and go to Radio Shack to buy an antenna, and then to the store to buy a literal ton of food. Many SMS's were exchanged, trying to figure out what superbowl food involves. Apparently it's mostly cheese-based. However, since it's Portland, and I'm me, I got a ton of meat and bacon to combine in delicious ways. That turned out well. Anyway, that, on top of a fuckton of alcohol to stave off the hangover, turned today into a very pleasant experience. The worst part was the truly awful sound engineering at the half-time show, which prompted my girlfriend to say, "She sounds like you at karaoke!" Sigh. But, all in all, GREAT GAME GUYS GO 'MERICA.
@mtrichardson Pics or it didn't happen!

Okay, story time ( this is slightly related ). One of our employees, Erik, grew up in Florida. He's a big guy - BIG GUY. His dad made him play football, even though he hated it. So, he grew up playing southern high school football, and since he's a big guy, he was always right up on the line. The trash talking there was absurd - "I'm gonna rape your cat and skull fuck your soul you piece of shit!" and so forth. So, he grows up in this environment, and then gets to go to Dartmouth. So, he's in an Ivy League school, and he's playing football, and he's up against Harvard, and the trash talking there is... sub par. "You're gonna be my employee one day!"
Knowing what I know now I consider Dartmouth's trash talk much scarier.
